name: learnlatex.GitHub.io
description: Browser-based LaTeX tutorial.

name: MacTeX
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for macOS, basically TeXLive with some Mac-specific tools added.

name: TeX Live
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for Unix-like operating systems, including GNU/Linux. Also works on Windows.

name: MikTeX
description: Most common LaTeX distribution for Windows, but also available for Mac, Linux or as Docker image.

name: pdfTeX
description: TeX compiler that produces PDF files immediately instead of DVI files (nowadays, this is the standard compiler for many users).

name: XeTeX
description: TeX compiler that provides better unicode and font support than TeX/pdfTeX (i.e. you can use the  fonts of your operating system instead of only TeX fonts).

name: LuaTeX
description: (La)TeX compiler that supports Lua code for scripting and has improved unicode and font support than standard TeX/pdfTeX.

name: tectonic
description: Modern, self contained (La)TeX compiler powered by XeTeX and TeXLive.

name: Auto-LaTeX Equations with Google Docs
description: Render high-quality math equations directly in Google Docs.

name: MathJaX
description: JavaScript engine to render mathematical formulas on the web. The outcome looks really slick.

name: mimeTeX
description: mimeTeX is a rather old tool to render LaTeX formulas to PNG figures for your web site, without actually needing a LaTeX installation on your server.

name: mathTeX
description: mathTeX is the successor of mimeTeX: it produces nicer-looking images but it requires LaTeX to be installed on your server.

name: KaTeX
description: KaTeX is a math rendering library made by Khan Academy focusing on fast load times. All output is processed as plain HTML instead of fixed images.

name: Franklin.jl
description: Static site generator with KaTeX support, code evaluation, LaTeX-like commands and optional pre-rendering, in Julia.

name: Purple Pi
description: Browser extension that lets you use LaTeX in GitHub pages, StackOverflow etc.

name: List of popular LaTeX editors
description: Community-maintained list of popular LaTeX editors including a screenshot and a short description.

name: Kile
description: Great LaTeX editor originally from the Linux/KDE community. It runs fine on Windows and macOS as well.

name: TeXMaker
description: Pretty good alternative to Kile.

name: TeXStudio
description: Cross-platform LaTeX editor that stems from TeXMaker.

name: WinEdt
description: The LaTeX editor many people swear by. Only for .

name: TeXnicCenter
description: Quite old but free and decent editor for LaTeX.

name: LyX
description: Cross-platform WYSIWYM editor that uses LaTeX behind the scenes to render documents.

name: TeXShop
description: No-nonsense editor for LaTeX documents which is included in MacTeX.

name: TeXWorks
description: No-nonsense editor for LaTeX code, modeled after TeXShop, but this one is cross-platform.

name: BakomaTex
description: Commercial LaTeX editor that allows to edit your document both using its source code and WYSIWYG.

name: Inlage
description: Commercial LaTeX editor with handwritten formula recognition, Excel importing and more nifty features.

name: Texpad
description: Commercial LaTeX editor for macOS and iOS, with excellent features (document overview, synchronised PDF display, autocompletion, sync across devices, etc.) that never get in the way of writing.

name: LaTeXTools
description: Atom port of the Sublime Text package of the same name.

name: LaTeXing
description: Commercial plug-in to edit LaTeX.

name: LaTeXTools
description: Free LaTeX plugin for Sublime Text.

name: AucTeX
description: Emacs plugin for LaTeX that also shows a preview of equations and figures.

name: RefTeX
description: Emacs plugin for LaTeX that adds support for labels, references, and citations.

name: LaTeX Live Preview
description: Instantly previews your LaTeX document.

name: vimtex
description: Modern vim plugin for editing LaTeX files. Has a variety of features including live preview and forward search.

name: TeXiFy-IDEA
description: Free LaTeX plugin for IntelliJ IDEA.

name: LaTeX Workshop
description: LaTeX extension for Visual Studio Code

name: List of popular online LaTeX editors
description: Community-maintained list of popular online LaTeX editor including equation editors.

name: Authorea
description: Online editor with built-in git support and bibliography tools.

name: ShareLaTeX
description: Has pretty great LaTeX documentation and simple version control.

name: Overleaf
description: Online editor, also with a WYSIWYM editor and git support.

name: Papeeria
description: Online editor with built-in git support.

name: JaxEdit
description: Online LaTeX editor with Live Preview and nice presentation mode.

name: JabRef
description: Very powerful cross-platform (Java) bibtex editor. The GUI looks quite dated, though.

name: Papis
description: Extremely customizable,

name: Bibdesk
description: Great bibliography editor for .

name: Zotero
description: Reference manager for your browser that also exports to bibtex and integrates with many LaTeX editors.

name: Mendeley
description: Both an app and cloud client to manage your references and PDFs. Can sync out to a bibtex file for your LaTeX workflow.

name: betterbib
description: Command-line utility for improving your BibTeX files. Fetches information from online sources.

name: Arara (GitHub repo)
description: Simple tool that allows you to specify which tools to call inside your document and it can be extended quite easily.

name: latexmk
description: Build tool that is the commonly used by many LaTeX editors (LaTeXing, TeXShop, etc.) to build your LaTeX files.

name: latex-makefile
description: Makefile based build tool that attempts to be as general and lightweight as possible.

name: CaTeX
description: Concatenates LaTeX documents with attention for properly merging the preamble.

name: Pandoc
description: This program converts almost any document format (LaTeX, DOC, markdown, etc.) to almost any other format. A great tool to aid workflows where multiple formats are used.

name: Codecogs Eqn Editor
description: Online LaTeX equation editor that allows you to produce figures containing an equation.

name: LaTeXiT
description: LaTeXit is an equation editor that makes it easy to drag-and-drop rendered equations (as PDF, PNG, etc.) into your non-LaTeX documents on the Mac.

name: KLaTeXFormula
description: Cross-platform alternative for LaTeXit.
